question: Question_09
sols:
Let ε \textgreater{} 0, we want to show that for some positive integer
\emph{N}\textsubscript{ε}, we have that

\begin{align*}\left| \left( -\frac{2}{3} \right)^n \right| < \varepsilon \quad \text{if } n \geq N_\varepsilon\end{align*}
First, we can get rid of the absolute value since

\begin{align*}\left| \left( -\frac{2}{3} \right)^n \right| = \left( \frac{2}{3} \right)^n\end{align*}
and so we wonder if for some value of \emph{n} large enough, we will
have

\begin{align*}\left( \frac{2}{3} \right)^n < \varepsilon\end{align*} for the value of ε that
we fixed (and that we think of as being a very small number). Since we
are interested in the value of \emph{n}, we take the logarithm on each
side and obtain

\begin{align*}\underbrace{\ln \left[ \left( \frac{2}{3} \right)^n \right]}_{= n\ln(2/3)} < \ln (\varepsilon)\end{align*}
Now since 2/3 is a number smaller than 1, its logarithm will be a
negative number, so when we divide in the above by ln(2/3) we have to
flip the inequality sign, we obtain

\begin{align*}n > \frac{\ln(\varepsilon)}{\ln(2/3)}\end{align*} Note that since ε is also a
very small number, its logarithm is also negative and hence the fraction
on the right-hand side is a positive number (as expected). We can thus
choose \emph{N}\textsubscript{ε} to be the nearest integer larger than
the fraction, which we can write as

\begin{align*}N_\varepsilon = \left\lceil \frac{\ln(\varepsilon)}{\ln(2/3)} \right\rceil\end{align*}
which concludes our proof.

\subsubsection{Note}\label{note}

It is not a bad idea to see that ε proofs allow you to actually compute
something about how quickly the sequence will converge to its limit. In
this case for example, if we choose ε = 0.001 then the above proof gives
us the value

\begin{align*}N_{0.001} = \left\lceil \frac{\ln(0.001)}{\ln(2/3)} \right\rceil = \left\lceil 17.0366 \right\rceil = 18\end{align*}
So for any \emph{n} $\geq$ 18, the value of
(-2/3)\textsuperscript{\emph{n}} should be less than 0.001, indeed we
have

\begin{align*}\left| \left( -\frac{2}{3} \right)^{17} \right| = 0.00101 \quad\text{and}\quad \left| \left( -\frac{2}{3} \right)^{18} \right| = 0.0006766\end{align*}
